page.title: 12Anna Valley Trout Farm.
page.content: Anna Valley Trout farm is situated on the Salisbury Road next to the Andover Garden Centre. The farm was started in 1981 and has now grown to have a large turnover of fish. The fish are kept outside in long tanks with a constant running water supply. The trout are fed five times a day on special fish pellets. The fish are reared from eggs that are bought from all over the world. The baby trout are called 'fingerlings'. On average 200 trout a day are sold to the public. There is a shop on the site which sells the fish and also pate made from the fish.
